soar.gui.plot_window¶

Tkinter wrapper for plotting using matplotlib

Note

Unlike use of the soar.hooks.tkinter_hook(), use of this module will not force brain methods to run on the main thread alongside Soar’s GUI event loop.

PlotWindow is wrapped by the client if it is imported by a Soar brain. This wrapper ensures that the proper mode (GUI or headless) is enforced, despite what the brain might pass to the constructor.

The client will also ensure that, if logging is occurring, any PlotWindow objects will have their image data included in the log whenever the controller is shut down.

Based on code written by Adam Hartz, August 1st 2012.

class soar.gui.plot_window.PlotWindow(title='Plotting Window', visible=True)¶

Bases: matplotlib.figure.Figure

Tk window containing a matplotlib plot. In addition to the functions described below, also supports all functions contained in matplotlib’s Axes and Figure objects.

Parameters:
  • title (str) – The title to be used for the initial window.
  • visible (bool) – Whether to actually display a Tk window (set to False to create and save plots without displaying a window).
clear()¶

Clear the plot, keeping the Tk window active.

destroy()¶

Destroy the Tk window.

Note that after calling this method (or manually closing the Tk window), this PlotWindow cannot be used.

legend(*args)¶

Create a legend for the figure (requires plots to have been made with labels)

make_window()¶

Pack the plot and matplotlib toolbar into the containing Tk window.

This method is called during initialization and it is unlikely you will need to call it elsewhere.

plot(*args, **kwargs)¶

Plot lines and/or markers to the Axes. See pyplot for more information.

save(fname, **kwargs)¶

Save this plot as an image. File type determined by extension of filename passed in.

See documentation for savefig.

Parameters:fname – The file to create, which may be a path or a file-like object.
show()¶

Update the canvas image (automatically called for most functions).

stay()¶

Start the Tkinter window’s main loop (e.g., to keep the plot open at the end of the execution of a script)

title(title)¶

Change the title of the Tk window
